mng: to rinse, to trick, to fool sb, to cook by dipping finely sliced ingredients briefly in boiling water or soup (generally done at the dining table)

exm.mng: to rinse, to trick, to fool sb, to cook by dipping finely sliced ingredients briefly in boiling water or soup (generally done at the dining table)
hot pot, a dish where thinly sliced meat and vegetables are boiled briefly in a broth and then served with dipping sauces
see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]
(coll.) to make fun of (sb), to play tricks on
